subject: JUnit test class reloading patch
msgSnippet: Hi, I d like to propose a fix for JUnit test class reloading. The proposed fix is a Java 2 custom ClassLoader that loads test classes from its own classpath
messageBody:
Hi,

I'd like to propose a fix for JUnit test class reloading. The proposed fix is a Java 2 custom ClassLoader that loads test classes from its own classpath and always delegates to the system/parent ClassLoader first without relying on anything like excluded.properties to filter system and non-system classes.

note: this is how Servlets, JSPs, EJBs, etc. are reloaded dynamically on change by J2EE containers that support dynamic reloads -- the Servlet, JSPs, EJBs, etc. are not on the system classpath, so the system classloader can always be delegated to and will not find the classes and this leave it to the custom loader(s) to load them. All defined in the Java 2 ClassLoader delegation contract.

The proposed means of configuring the custom loader's classpath is to use a Java system property named "junit.test.path". This can be set as a command line argument, or could be read from a properties file.

I have implemented this proposal in a small patch that can be downloaded here:

http://users.rcn.com/scottstirling/junit-patch.jar.

A regression test (XmlTest.java) and series of steps for reproducing the original TestCaseClassLoader bug and running the test with the patch are here:

http://users.rcn.com/scottstirling/2003/07/19.html#a61

Thank you,

Scott Stirling
Framingham, MA
